bibl.title: Ng Kwack Kang v. King County. Stipulation
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p:
In The United States District Court, In and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the matter of the Application of Ng Kwack Kang, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
No. 3157 Stipulation
It is hereby agreed and stipulated by and between Adam Beeler, attorney for Petitioner, Ng Kwack Kang, and Clay Allen and Goerge P. Fishburne, United States District Attorney, and Assistant United States District Attorney for the United States Government, that the petitioner may have until Dec 6/1915days in order to get certified copies of the court records, and that thereafter the case may be set down for hearing on said Dec 6th
Dated this tenth day of November, 1915.
Clay Allen United States District Attorney
Albert Moodie Asst. U.S. Dist. Atty - for United States Government
Adam Beeler Attorney for Petitioner, Ng Kwack Kang

Original In The U.S. District Court
In and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
Plaintiff In the Matter of the Application of Ng Kwack Kang, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Defendant Stipulation
Beeler and Sullivan Lawyers 510-11 White Building Seattle, Wash.
Filed in the U.S. District Court Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Nov 11 1915 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk. By EML Deputy
